column1: Sultan Babullah Airport (Indonesian: Bandar Udara Sultan Babullah) (IATA: TTE
column4: is located in the Indonesian province of North Maluku
column5: close to the city of Ternate. The airport is named after Indonesian warrior Sultan Babullah of Ternate. The airport serves as the main access to the province
column6: with a high flow of both passengers and cargo. In the long run
column7: government policy regarding air transport development plans will be aimed at the development of infrastructure and service at the airport
column8: allowing for further routes to and from the city. The Airport is operated and managed by UPT Ditjen Hubud. Terminal Facilities The terminal is equipped with a bank
